question: Give me a comparison between EMBED and DMID dataset.
answer: The EMBED dataset is the largest mammogram dataset available, with 3.4 million images, while the DMID dataset is the most recent, published in 2024, with only 510 images. The EMBED dataset has a racially diverse data with mammogram images, clinical data, and metadata, while the DMID dataset contains mammogram images, metadata, and radiological reports.
generated_answer:
The EMBED dataset is the largest mammogram dataset available, with 3,383,659 screening and diagnostic mammogram images from 115,910 patients. Among these, 20% of the total 2D and C-view dataset is available for research use. This 20% contains Total 480,606 dicom images, Total 676,009 png images (20%) and Total 34,004 spot magnified images. It also has 4 files of clinical data and metadata.

The EMBED dataset was created to address the imbalances in datasets for machine learning models and to provide racially diverse data. The EMBED dataset contains breast imaging studies including mammogram images, clinical data, and metadata.

DMID is the most recent mammogram dataset published in 2024 with only 510 images. It also has associated radiology reports which can be used for synthetic data generation.

In terms of usage, both datasets are available upon signing agreements. However, DMID is also publicly available in another site

question: Tell me something about OPTIMAM dataset.
answer: The dataset is an extended version of OMI-DB. This dataset contains 3,072,878 images from 172,282 women. The data has 4 classes namely “Normal”, “Interval Cancer”, “Benign”, and  “Malignant”. Of the 7661 screen-detected cancers from episodes with digital images, 5097 have been marked (67% of cancers). It is an extended version of OMI-DB.
